### get_top

``` python

def get_top(
    folder
):

```

``` python
with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as td:
    test_eq(get_top(td), None)
    msg = callgit(td, 'init')
    assert get_top(td) in msg
```

[`Git`](https://AnswerDotAI.github.io/fastgit/core.html#git) represents
a python wrapper for the `git` command. It will execute every command as
if `git` were being run with the working directory being the directory
`d` passed in at init time.

As a result, callers should take care not to checkout a branch which
does not have the directory used to initialize
[`Git`](https://AnswerDotAI.github.io/fastgit/core.html#git).

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<a
href="https://github.com/AnswerDotAI/fastgit/blob/main/fastgit/core.py#L29"
target="_blank" style="float:right; font-size:smaller">source</a>

### Git

``` python
def Git(
    d
):

```

*Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.*

``` python
with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as td:
    g = Git(td)
    assert not g.exists
    msg = g.init()
    assert g.top() in msg
```
